ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Selos Song of Travel
ygData.msgSnippet: John Kim did timing numbers on Selos, SSot, and Selos+Lev. They are all the same.  The difference in speed you feel is because you are farther from the land
ygData.messageBody:
John Kim did timing numbers on Selos, SSot, and Selos+Lev. They are all the
same. The difference in speed you 'feel' is because you are farther from
the land textures, giving the illusion of slower movmement. This is why a
gnome feels like it is running faster then an Ogre as well.

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Monday, February 05, 2001 4:35 PM
> To: EQBards
> Subject: [eqbards] Selos Song of Travel
>
>
> Just dinged 51 last night and used this song for the first
> time. With Selos
> Drum equipped, the movement rate with the 51 song seemed to
> be slower than
> Selos Accelerando. I was in Burning Woods so that may have
> had an impact on
> my perception. Is the speed bonus for these songs the same or is
> Accelerando indeed faster? I have read that when you have a regular
> levitate buff up and sing Selos, the fastest you will go is
> SOW speed. This
> is approximately how fast I was going last night with SSoT.
> So either SSoT
> is slower because of the levitate effect or my perception was off.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
>
